resources.string: Dose diary is a simple app to help adults record their paracetamol (or acetominophen) intake.
Paracetamol should only be taken as directed on the label or leaflet, or as instructed by a health professional.

Notes on paracetamol from the NHS website: 
How much paracetamol you can take depends on your age, your weight, the type of paracetamol you're taking and how strong it is. 
Adults can usually take one or two 500mg tablets every 4-6 hours, but shouldn't take more than 4g (eight 500mg tablets) in the space of 24 hours. 
Be careful not to use other medications that contain paracetamol as an ingredient (such as some cold and flu remedies) while you're taking paracetamol.
